attention1.ptxt: Do not apply vacuum using your mouth; otherwise harmful fuel vapor can be breathed in.

attention2.ptxt: Do not apply vacuum of more than –67 kPa (–0.68 kgf/cm², –9.72 psi, –0.67 bar); otherwise EVAP canister purge valve could be damaged.

s1.ptxt: Prepare to operate EVAP canister purge valve as follows.

item.ptxt: Connect SUZUKI scan tool to DLC (1) with ignition switch turned to OFF.
Turn ignition switch to ON, clear DTC(s) and select “Engine / Active Test” mode on SUZUKI scan tool.

attention3.ptxt: EVAP canister purge valve is operated using scan tool as follows.

item.ptxt: To turn OFF EVAP canister purge valve: 0%
To turn ON EVAP canister purge valve: 100%

attention3.ptxt: Before performing this check, be sure to read Precautions for ECM Circuit Inspection:J24B .

item.ptxt: Connect special tool (ECM check harness) between ECM and ECM connector.

attention3.ptxt: Operate EVAP canister purge valve using service wire as follows.

item.ptxt: To turn ON EVAP canister purge valve:
Connect “C37-7” terminal and vehicle body ground [b]
To turn ON EVAP canister purge valve:
Disconnect “C37-7” terminal and vehicle body ground [a]

s1.ptxt: Disconnect vacuum hose (2) from intake manifold and purge hose from EVAP canister purge valve (1).
Install special tool to vacuum hose.
Check EVAP canister purge valve operation.
If faulty condition is found, check the following.

item.ptxt: Check that vacuum of –60 kPa (–0.6 kgf/cm², –8.7 psi, –0.6 bar) can be applied when EVAP canister purge valve is turned OFF [A].
Check that no vacuum can be applied when EVAP canister purge valve is turned ON [B].
